events.name: IoT with XDK- Cross Domain Development Kit-Bosch Connected Devices and Solutions
events.description: XDK Cross Domain Development Kit is a programmable sensor device & a prototyping platform for any IoT use case you can imagine. Built for Bosch Connected Devices and Solutions to create IoT products, XDK has evolved continuously and is not only a prototyping platform but also a sensor node solution. In this session, we will share more details on how you can build IoT applications with XDK and share some example demos as well. SPEAKER: Frederik Tröster  Since July 2016 Frederik has been heading up the new Bosch Connected Devices and Solutions operations in ASEAN at Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. Bosch Connected Devices and Solutions develops and sells innovative sensor devices and solutions for the IoT (Internet of Things) market with a special focus on Industry 4.0, Logistics and Connected Mobility. From 2010 until mid of 2016 Frederik set-up Bosch’s solar panel and later also its solar inverter & battery storage system business in the Australian market. Before joining the Bosch group Frederik worked in several management roles for German automotive suppliers in Germany and China. Frederik is holding a BSc in Industrial Engineering and a MBA ************************************************************  DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 1st June 2017 • 06:00 pm – Registration/ Networking & Snacks (Sponsored by Bosch) • 06:50 pm – Introduction by CK • 07:00 pm – Talk & Demo by Frederik Tröster • 08:15 pm –  QnA  • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01, SG139951 ************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Indorse & Status.im Keynote Special
events.description:
Hi Etherians, Indorse is a decentralized social networking platform that gives back ownership of the data to the user, allowing them to profit from sharing their skills, activities on the platform. Indorse is a proud project from Attores, the Blockchain as a Service company on Ethereum. David Moskowitz, co-founder and CEO of Attores, will share more on this new project spinoff from Attores.   Jarrad is the Co-Founder of Status, an open source mobile client for the Ethereum Network. As an entrepreneur he has founded several successful startups, primarily around software distribution. He has also been an active member in the Ethereum community since 2014, establishing the Ethereum Amsterdam Meetup, and possesses a deep appreciation for blockchain technology, cryptoeconomics and the movement towards libre software. </a><a href="https://status.im/">Status.im is an open source messaging platform and mobile interface to interact with decentralized applications that run on the Ethereum Network. In his talk, Jarrad will be discussing the launch of the Status Network, his thoughts on where he believes mobile technology is heading, and why Ethereum and decentralisation is important in this context.  Event Schedule: 6:30pm - 7:00pm : Registration 7:00pm - 7:15pm : Indorse Talk by David Moskowitz 7:20pm - 8:00pm : Status.im Talk by Jarrad Hope and Carl Bennetts 





Event Organizers:  


 


Venue Sponsor:  


Regards, Ethereum Singapore Organizers

events.name: Modern Application Architecture Beyond Microservices
events.description:
Please confirm RSVP here: https://goo.gl/forms/ntCXwQasGQ2e0l3x1 Lope Emano from honestbee will deliver a short introduction to Microservices to level set the audience on the topic of Microservices.   


Siamak Sadeghianfar from Red Hat will deliver a talk on Modern Application Architecture Beyond Microservices   


It's a one-hour demo on what is needed and what to think about after dev teams have built a microservices application running on Kubernetes or OpenShift. It covers * service resilience * agile integration * development workflows * continuous delivery * zero downtime deployment in production * continuous security compliance * etc and brings in a multitude of open source projects and Red Hat products.
events.location: Red Hat, 8 Shenton Way, 10-01 AXA Tower, 068811 Singapore
